dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 695 IH: State and Local General Sales Tax Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Napolitano (for herself, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Garamendi, and Mr. David Scott of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to clarify the use of certain taxes and revenues.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State and Local General Sales Tax Protection Act.

subsection.header: Written assurances on use of revenue
subsection.text: Section 47107(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in each of paragraphs (1) and (2) by striking local taxes and inserting local excise taxes;
in paragraph (3) by striking State tax and inserting State excise tax; and
by adding at the end the following:
This subsection does not apply to State or local general sales taxes nor to State or local generally applicable sales taxes.

subsection.text: Section 47133 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking Local taxes and inserting Local excise taxes;
in subsection (b)(1) by striking local taxes and inserting local excise taxes;
in subsection (c) by striking State tax and inserting State excise tax; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: This subsection does not apply to—

paragraph.text: State or local general sales taxes; or
State or local generally applicable sales taxes.
